title: Chad You
text:
Hi there!
I‚Äôm Chad You, Sr Database Administrator at VUMC Health Policy, where I lead the Data Core team.
Professionaly, I love teaching healthcare analytics, researching digital health, and developing data solutions.
If you‚Äôve found my blogs helpful and want to buy me a coffee or tea, feel free to contribute over at ko-fi.com/chadyou.
Outside of work, I love to practice Aikido at Nashville Aikikai.

title: Population Health Curriculum
text:
The Robert Graham Center, HealthLandscape, American Board of Family Medicine, and Community Health Center, Inc.¬†collaborated to develop this curriculum aimed to introduce health care professionals to population health concepts and tools. Resources include slides and note sets, three case studies with sample data, and a performance improvement activity.
üîó Population Health Curriculum

title: Interactive 2024 KIDS Data Book
text:
Children‚Äôs good health is fundamental to their overall development, and ensuring kids are born healthy is the first step toward improving their life chances. Exposure to violence, family stress, inadequate housing, lack of preventive health care, poor nutrition, poverty and substance abuse undermine children‚Äôs health. Poor health in childhood affects other critical aspects of children‚Äôs lives, such as school readiness and attendance, and can have lasting consequences on their future health and well-being.
Learn more in the 2024 KIDS COUNT Data Book.
üîó Interactive 2024 Data Book - Health

title: The Great CEO Within
text: The book ‚ÄúThe Great CEO Within‚Äù is a compendium of solutions for tech startup CEOs. Written by a coach who works with Silicon Valley CEOs, it addresses common challenges faced by founders and leaders.

title: The Great CEO Within
text:
Key Takeaways

CEO Training Matters:

Becoming a great CEO requires training.
The book provides practical solutions for time-strapped CEOs.

Book Structure:

The book covers eight sections:

The Beginning: Starting a company and launching a team.
Individual Habits: Crucial habits for effectiveness.
Group Habits: Effective teamwork behaviors.
Infrastructure: Tools for company effectiveness.
Collaboration: Techniques for cohesive work.
Process: Systems for major functions.
Other Departments: Beyond the core team.
Appendices: Miscellaneous topics.


For CEOs at All Stages:

Whether you‚Äôre a first-time or experienced CEO, this book offers frameworks and answers.
Use it as a checklist for best practices and immediate implementation.


Remember, being a great CEO is about continuous learning and adaptation. Dive into the book for detailed insights!

Feel free to explore the book further, and if you have any other requests, just let me know! üòäüëç
üîó The Great CEO Within

title: How to make your scientific data accessible, discoverable and useful
text:
How to make your scientific data accessible, discoverable and useful?
Check out these seven tips for effectively sharing your data, which is published on Nature.
Seven tips:
- Craft metadata
- Over-share
- Embrace standards
- Consider the format
- Include code
- Think accessibility
- Take the plunge
üîó How to make your scientific data accessible, discoverable and useful

title: Unlocking Data Maturity: A Journey Toward Data-as-a-Product
text:
In the ever-evolving landscape of data management, the concept of the data mesh has gained significant traction. But how do organizations practically embark on this transformation? Olivier Wulveryck sheds light on a novel approach that combines evolutionary thinking with data maturity. Buckle up as we explore the path to treating data as a product!




Domain-Oriented Design: Start by aligning your data mesh with existing organizational structures. Think of it as laying the groundwork for a comprehensive understanding of your data landscape.
Data-as-a-Product: Imagine data as a tangible product, with clear ownership, quality standards, and value propositions. This mindset shift is crucial for successful data mesh adoption.
Federated Computational Governance: Simplify development by enabling self-service data platforms. These platforms empower teams to create interconnections seamlessly.
Self-Service Data Platforms: These platforms are enablers, supporting the data mesh vision. They allow teams to access, explore, and utilize data efficiently.




Drawing inspiration from Simon Wardley‚Äôs evolution model, we visualize data maturity within a business context. Here‚Äôs how it works:

Data Acquisition: Prepare data for easy utilization by Language Models (LLMs). Clean, structured data is the foundation.
Transformation: Convert data into a mathematical representation. Think of it as creating a bridge between raw data and actionable insights.
Data Contracts: Implement data contracts to ensure trust and seamless integration. Treat data like a valuable product with clear terms and conditions.




When will your organization start reaping the benefits of data contracts and data-as-a-product? Look for that tipping point‚Äîthe moment when data maturity unlocks efficiency, collaboration, and innovation.
Remember, the data mesh isn‚Äôt just a buzzword; it‚Äôs a strategic shift. So, embrace the evolution, treat data as your prized product, and watch your organization thrive!
üîó Data-as-a-Product and Data-Contract: An evolutionary approach to data maturity

title: How to create a personal website using Quarto and Azure
text:
1. Buy a domain name

Namecheap is cheaper than big names like GoDaddy. The website is very to use. Let‚Äôs go with namecheap.com.
Click ‚ÄúSIGN UP‚Äù to create an account.

title: How to create a personal website using Quarto and Azure
section: 2. Create a website project using Quarto in local
text:
2. Create a website project using Quarto in local

Follow the instruction on Quarto, Create a website project using Quarto.
You can use either VS Code, RStudio, or Terminal to run Quarto. Choose your favoriate.

title: How to create a personal website using Quarto and Azure
text:
3. Publish your project to GitHub

If you have a GitHub account, create a new repo from your Quarto project directory, commit the changes, then push to GitHub.

title: How to create a personal website using Quarto and Azure
section: 4. Create a static web app using Azure Static Web Apps
text:
4. Create a static web app using Azure Static Web Apps

Follow this instruction to publish your website using Azure Static Web Apps. Quickstart: Build your first static site with Azure Static Web Apps

title: How to create a personal website using Quarto and Azure
section: 5. Set up domain DNS in namecheap
text:
5. Set up domain DNS in namecheap

Copy your app link from Azure Portal under Custom domains. 
Open the Advanced DNS tab in your namecheap account, creat a new ‚ÄúCNAME Record‚Äù and add the app link as below.

set Host as ‚Äúwww‚Äù.
set TTL as ‚Äú5 min‚Äù

title: Steve jobs popularized the term podcast. Is podcasting still a good business model?
text:
üéôÔ∏è Steve jobs popularized the term ‚Äúpodcast‚Äù. Is podcasting still a good business model?
Yes. Podcasting continues to be a viable business model with several trends.
ùüè. ùêèùê®ùêùùêúùêöùê¨ùê≠ ùêÄùêùùêØùêûùê´ùê≠ùê¢ùê¨ùê¢ùêßùê†: Ad spend in podcasting is still increasing. Marketers recognize the engaged audience and are investing more in podcast ads.
ùüê. ùêÇùê®ùê¶ùê©ùêûùê≠ùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêÅùêûùê≠ùê∞ùêûùêûùêß ùêÄùê©ùê©ùê¨: Platforms like Apple Podcasts, Spotify, and iHeartRadio compete for listeners. Each offers unique features and subscription options.
ùüë. ùêÑùêöùê¨ùê¢ùêûùê´ ùêÄùêù ùêèùê´ùê®ùêùùêÆùêúùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß: Podcast ads are becoming easier to produce and place, making monetization more accessible for creators.
ùüí. ùêÉùê¢ùêØùêûùê´ùê¨ùêû ùêåùê®ùêßùêûùê≠ùê¢ùê≥ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêíùê≠ùê´ùêöùê≠ùêûùê†ùê¢ùêûùê¨: Beyond advertising, podcasts explore revenue streams like foundation grants, direct support, subscriptions, and live events.
ùüì. ùêÜùê´ùê®ùê∞ùê≠ùê° ùê®ùêü ùêãùê¢ùêØùêû ùêèùê®ùêùùêúùêöùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê†: Live podcast events continue to gain popularity, connecting creators with their audiences in real-time.
ùüî. ùêàùêßùêßùê®ùêØùêöùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêû ùêÜùê´ùê®ùê∞ùê≠ùê° ùêíùê≠ùê´ùêöùê≠ùêûùê†ùê¢ùêûùê¨: Podcasters are experimenting with new ways to grow their shows, from cross-promotions to collaborations.
ùüï. ùêÑùêùùêÆùêúùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùêûùêßùê≠: Listeners crave learning, so educational and informative podcasts remain in demand.
ùüñ. ùêçùêûùê∞ ùêñùêöùê≤ùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùêîùê¨ùêû ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùêûùêßùê≠: Audiences are finding creative ways to use podcast content, from educational purposes to inspiration.
In summary, podcasting remains a dynamic space with opportunities for creators and marketers alike. Focusing on ùêûùêùùêÆùêúùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùêöùêßùêù ùê¢ùêßùêüùê®ùê´ùê¶ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêû ùê©ùê®ùêùùêúùêöùê¨ùê≠ùê¨ is a good start.
üîó Steve Job‚Äôs video

title: Happy 4th of July
text:
On July 4th, the United States celebrates Independence Day. Besides the American flag, one common decoration for this holiday is the half-circle flag shown below.

I‚Äôve always wondered what this type of flag is called. After asking MS Copilot, I learned a new term: pleated flags.

Pleated flags, also known as bunting flags, are typically hung indoors or outdoors during festivals or celebrations for decorative purposes. Here are some general guidelines:

Design: Pleated flags are usually half-circle or fan-shaped. They often feature a combination of red, white, and blue to resemble the American flag.
Usage: They are commonly used during patriotic events, holidays, or celebrations, adding a festive touch to homes, businesses, and public spaces.
Material: Pleated flags are typically made from lightweight, durable bunting fabric. Traditional materials include cotton or polyester.
Display: When displaying half-circle flags:

Hang them vertically or horizontally.
Secure them properly to prevent sagging or twisting.
Avoid using them as actual flags on flagpoles; they are decorative items.
